title: BodyAngularVelocity

    "content": "This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.

name: BodyAngularVelocity
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  Applies a torque to maintain a constant angular velocity.
description: |
  The BodyAngularVelocity object applies a torque (rotational force) on an
  assembly such that it maintains a constant angular velocity as determined by
  its Class.BodyAngularVelocity.AngularVelocity|AngularVelocity property. This
  allows for the creation of assemblies that continually rotate. It is the
  rotational counterpart to a Class.BodyVelocity. If you would like to
  maintain a constant angular displacement, use a Class.BodyGyro instead.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - BodyMover
descendants: []
tags:
  - Deprecated
deprecationmessage: |
  This object is deprecated and should not be used for new work. Use
  Class.AngularVelocity instead, and see the
  legacy conversion notes.
properties:
  - name: BodyAngularVelocity.AngularVelocity
    summary: |
      Determines the axis of rotation (direction) and the rotational velocity
      (magnitude) in radians/s.
    description: |
      This property is a Datatype.Vector3 which determines the goal angular
      velocity a Class.BodyAngularVelocity should maintain through the
      exertion of torque. For this property, the direction of the vector is the
      axis of rotation. The magnitude is the angular velocity in radians per
      second.

      You can multiply a Datatype.Vector3 by Library.math.rad(360), or 2Ï€,
      in order to convert angular frequency (rotations per second) into the
      desired angular velocity (radians per second).
    codesamples: []
    type: Vector3
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Goals
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: BodyAngularVelocity.angularvelocity
    summary: ''
    description: ''
    codesamples: []
    type: Vector3
    tags:
      - NotReplicated
      - Deprecated
    deprecationmessage: |
      This deprecated property is a variant of
      Class.BodyAngularVelocity.AngularVelocity which should be used instead.
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Goals
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: false
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: BodyAngularVelocity.MaxTorque
    summary: |
      Determines the limit of torque that may be exerted on each world axis.
    description: |
      This property determines the limit of the torque that may be exerted on
      each world axis. If an assembly isn't moving, consider raising this value
      and also check that it is not Class.BasePart.Anchored|Anchored or
      attached to another anchored assembly). See also
      Class.BodyAngularVelocity.P|P (power).
    codesamples: []
    type: Vector3
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Goals
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: BodyAngularVelocity.maxTorque
    summary: |
      Determines how much force can be applied to each axis.
    description: |
      The maxTorque property is a deprecated variant of
      Class.BodyAngularVelocity.MaxTorque that lets you set how much force
      could be applied to each axis.
    codesamples: []
    type: Vector3
    tags:
      - NotReplicated
      - Deprecated
    deprecationmessage: |
      This deprecated property is a variant of
      Class.BodyAngularVelocity.MaxTorque which should be used instead.
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Goals
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: false
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: BodyAngularVelocity.P
    summary: |
      Determines how aggressive of a torque is applied in reaching the goal
      angular velocity.
    description: |
      This property determines how much power is used while applying torque in
      order to reach the goal
      Class.BodyAngularVelocity.AngularVelocity|AngularVelocity. The higher
      this value, the more power will be used and the faster it will be used.
    codesamples: []
